programme.title: The Second
programme.desc: An author's success following the release of her celebrated erotic memoir is threatened when her best friend and muse reveals the truth behind the memoir's provenance, igniting an incendiary tale of sex, lies and betrayal.

programme.title: Timeline
programme.desc: A romantic reunion turns into a life-or-death game of secrets and survival, where the past cannot stay hidden.

programme.title: Life Feels Good
programme.desc: The true story of Mateusz, a man suffering from cerebral palsy, who in his early childhood had been diagnosed as a retard with no contact with the outside world. After twenty-five years it turned out that he was a perfectly normal and intelligent person.

programme.title: Until Tomorrow
programme.desc: A single mother's courage is tested when she resorts to desperate measures to hide her illegitimate child from her parents.

programme.title: Risks And Side Effects
programme.desc: When Pilates trainer Kathrin needs a new kidney, her husband’s hesitation to be her donor results in a crisis in their marriage. Faced with issues of life and death, the fragility of the couple’s relationship is laid bare.

programme.title: The Cloud Is Gone
programme.desc: A married man remembers moments related to his late wife in some familiar local places in the countryside of Vietnam. Witnessing the inevitable change of the city racing to develop, he bitterly thought about the important moment that he had missed.

programme.title: Murder in Biot
programme.desc: A wealthy heiress is poisoned during a dinner of the Biot Trade Association. All the guests are potential suspects. Two days later, one of the guests dies leaving a suicide note and confessing to the murder. But Deputy Prosecutor Richard is unconvinced.

programme.title: Milk Teeth
programme.desc: Living in a small rural community, Skalde navigates societal stigma due to having an “outsider” mother. When she befriends a mysterious girl in the woods, Skalde jeopardizes everything, struggling to balance loyalty to her community and her newfound bond.

programme.title: Once Upon A Time In Calcutta
programme.desc: Having just lost her daughter and disillusioned with her marriage, Ela decides to start an independent life of her own. Unable to secure a housing loan, she uses her boss, the owner of a ponzi scheme, to get what she wants.

programme.title: A Wedding
programme.desc: Zahira, eighteen years old, a Belgian-Pakistani girl wants to keep the baby growing inside her. Amir, her brother and confidant, promises to help her. But the parents have other ideas for the young girl.

programme.title: Murders in Porquerolles
programme.desc: The lifeless body of a painter is found on a beach in Porquerolles. Her body at the foot of the cliff evokes the Lycastre, the famous dragon from the legend that gave the bay its name. A rigid prosecutor and a whimsical policewoman team up to investigate.

programme.title: Road To Your Heart
programme.desc: In this sweet road-trip movie, Basson, a young businessman journeys to Cape Town for his father’s funeral and to fulfill certain tasks in the will. He meets bohemian Amory along the way and they encounter hilarious moments, disappointments and heartaches.

programme.title: Cloves & Carnations
programme.desc: In snowy and desolate South Eastern Anatolian, Musa carries the corpse of his deceased wife to their homeland with his granddaughter. As they get closer to a country at war, their run-in with the police separates them in different directions.

programme.title: Jeanny: The Fifth Girl
programme.desc: In a picturesque tiny town near Vienna, young girls have been vanishing without a trace for years. Jeanny has just fallen in love with a mysterious man. But when she notices signs of a dark side in him, she becomes suspicious. Will she be the next victim?
